channel.title: Brayden's Rants and Recipes (Posts by Tracy Handley)

item.title: Dill Cottage Cheese Bread
item.dc:creator: Tracy Handley
item.description:
Ingredients

1 package dry yeast

1/4 cup warm water

1 cup creamed cottage cheese

2 tablespoons sugar

1 tablespoon minced onion

1 teaspoon dill seed

1 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon baking soda

1 egg beaten

2 1/4 to 2 1/2 cups flour

Directions

  1. In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water.

  2. In a saucepan, heat the cottage cheese, sugar, onion, dill seed, salt, and baking soda to lukewarm. Add this mixture to dissolved yeast and beat in the egg.

  3. Gradually stir in flour to form a soft dough. Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes. Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning to grease the surface. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a wamr place for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until double in bulk.

  4. Punmch down and cover. Let the dough rest 10 minutes. Shape into a loaf and place in a greased 9 inch by 5 inch by 3 inch loaf pan. Let rise, covered, in a warm place for 1 hour or until double in bulk.

  5. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Remove bread from the pan and brush with butter. Slice with serrated knife when cool.

Notes

Can omit the dill for a wonderful, simple white bread.

item.title: Perfect Sauce or Gravy Base
item.dc:creator: Tracy Handley
item.description:
Ingredients

Base Ingredients

3 tablespoons of fat (ex: butter or grease)

3 tablespoons of flour
Variations
Sauce

Add green chile

Gravy

Use stock for the liquid

Gravy for Biscuits

Use bacon grease for fat and milk for liquid

Directions

  1. In a sauce pan, heat the fat.

  2. Whisk in flour until well combined and no unincorporated flour remains. Brown for two minutes.

  3. Slowly add liquid while stirring constantly.

  4. Stirring constantly, bring to a simmer and cook until desired consistency.

item.title: Chicken Picatta
item.dc:creator: Tracy Handley
item.description:
Recommend serving over angelhair pasta with a side of roasted asparagus.

Ingredients

chicken breasts

flour, seasoned with salt and pepper

white wine

lemon juice

butter

2 tablespoons capers

Directions

  1. Pound chicken to desired thinness. Dredge in flour.

  2. Saute dredged chicken in a half olive oil, half butter mixture until golden.

  3. Move chicken to plate. Slowly pour wine into pan to deglaze. Add lemon juice to taste (be generous).

  4. Stir in capers. Continue stirring until sauce thickens. Pour over the chicken, and heat in oven for 10 minutes.

item.title: Wry Braid (Onion Bread)
item.dc:creator: Tracy Handley
item.description:
Ingredients

2 packages active dry yeast

2 cups warm water

1 envelope onion soup mix

1/3 c sugar

2 tbsp molasses

1 tsp salt

1 egg

1/3 c soft shortening

Directions

  1. In mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add soup mix, stir to dissolve completely.

  2. Add remaining ingredients, but only half of the flour. Beat with a spoon until smooth.

  3. Mix in enough remaining flour until dough handles easily. Turn onto a lightly floured board. Knead until smooth (about 10 minutes).

  4. Place in greased bowl, turning once to bring greased side up. Cover with cloth, let rise (in warm place - 85 degrees) until double, about 1 hour.

  5. Divide dough in half. Divide each half into 3 equal parts and roll into a 14 strand. Place on a greased baking sheet, braid loosely, fasten ends and tuck under securely. Brush with butter and cover with cloth. Let it rise until it doubles, about 40 to 50 minutes.

  6. Bake in oven at 375 degrees 25 to 30 minutes. Makes two braids.
